Package mrbaxmypka.gmail.com.mapPointsTrimmer.xml

Class HtmlHandler

java.lang.Object
mrbaxmypka.gmail.com.mapPointsTrimmer.xml.HtmlHandler
@Component
public class HtmlHandler
extends java.lang.Object
HTML processing class based on Jsoup library to parse only CDATA as HTML.

  • Method Details

    • processDescriptionText

      public java.lang.String processDescriptionText​(java.lang.String description, MultipartMainDto multipartMainDto)
      Parameters:
      description - Receives inner text from <description>...</description> which in fact is the HTML markup
      multipartMainDto - To determine all other conditions to be processed on CDATA HTML
      Returns:
      Fully processed HTML markup to be included in CDATA block.

    • getAllImagesFromDescription

      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllImagesFromDescription​(java.lang.String description)

    • extractPlainTextDescriptions

      private java.lang.String extractPlainTextDescriptions​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment)
      The given CDATA may contain a plain texts before or after HTML markup. So here we extract a possible text (as TextNode) to append it back to the processed HTML
      Returns:
      Extracted plain text or empty string.

    • setPath

      private void setPath​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment, PathTypes pathType, java.lang.String path)
      Sets new local or remote paths instead old ones. I.e. old path <a href="files:/_1404638472855.jpg"></> can be replaced with <a href="C:/files:/a new path/_1404638472855.jpg"></>

    • getNewHrefWithOldFilename

      java.lang.String getNewHrefWithOldFilename​(@Nullable java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename, PathTypes pathType, java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)
      Each existing a[href] contains a full path with the filename as the last text element. Here we have to replace only the URL and leave the original filename.

    • getNewRelativeHref

      private java.lang.String getNewRelativeHref​(java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename, java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)

    • getLocusAttachmentAbsoluteHref

      java.lang.String getLocusAttachmentAbsoluteHref​(java.lang.String oldHrefAbsoluteTypeWithFilename, MultipartMainDto multipartMainDto)
      Locus Map <lc:attachment></lc:attachment> receives only PathTypes.RELATIVE or PathTypes.ABSOLUTE without (!) 'file:///' prefix.
      Returns:
      1) Locus specific absolute type of path like: '/sdcard/Locus/photos/' 2) Relative type of path (starting with '../', '/' or folder name like 'Locus/photos/' 3) Empty String if the given href starting with 'www.' or 'http://'

    • getNewAbsoluteHref

      private java.lang.String getNewAbsoluteHref​(java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename, java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)

    • getNewWebHref

      private java.lang.String getNewWebHref​(java.lang.String oldHrefWithFilename, java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)

    • trimNewHrefWithoutFilename

      private java.lang.String trimNewHrefWithoutFilename​(java.lang.String newHrefWithoutFilename)

    • setPreviewSize

      private void setPreviewSize​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment, MultipartMainDto multipartMainDto)
      1) Sets preview size in pixels for all Elements. 2) Checks if the given Elements are presented as links within . If not, wrap images with to create links. 3) Creates a new description within Locus Pro ... with User's text and images. For Locus Pro <!-- desc_user:start --> and <!-- desc_user:end --> are the markers for displaying all inner data and text on POI screen (description text, photo, photo data etc). So when MultipartMainDto#getPreviewSize() != null to display it on the screen these comments have to embrace all the description.

    • setStyleToElement

      private void setStyleToElement​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element element, java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Sets an additional "style" into that attribute for the given Element, e.g.
      . If no "style" attribute presented it will be added.
      Parameters:
      element - Element
      key - The "style" attribute key
      value - The "style" attribute value

    • setPreviewSizeInStyles

      private void setPreviewSizeInStyles​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element imgElement, int previewSize, PreviewSizeUnits sizeUnit)
      Sets the new preview size into inline "Style" attributes as "width", "max-width"
      Parameters:
      imgElement - With obligatory "style" attribute
      previewSize - Ready to use value, eg. "640px".

    • getStylesKeyMap

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getStylesKeyMap​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element element)
      Returns:
      Map of Element's "style" attribute as key-value pair. E.g. 'style="width: 200px; max-width: 250px" return "style" attributes as HashMap with key="width", value="200px" etc. Or empty HashMap if no "style' attribute presented.

    • trimDescriptions

      private java.lang.String trimDescriptions​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment)
      Returns:
      Trimmed String inline without redundant whitespaces and line breaks.

    • clearOutdatedDescriptions

      private void clearOutdatedDescriptions​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment, MultipartMainDto multipartMainDto)
      Removes all the unnecessary HTML nodes and data duplicates. MUST be the last method in a chain.

    • getAElementWithInnerImgElement

      private org.jsoup.nodes.Element getAElementWithInnerImgElement​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element imgElement)
      Parameters:
      imgElement - To be copied and inserted into
      Returns:
      New Element with the copy of given Element

    • getAElementsWithInnerImgElement

      private org.jsoup.select.Elements getAElementsWithInnerImgElement​(org.jsoup.select.Elements imgElements)

    • createNewHtmlDescription

      private org.jsoup.nodes.Element createNewHtmlDescription​(java.lang.String userDescription, MultipartMainDto multipartMainDto)
      For Locus Pro <!-- desc_user:start --> and <!-- desc_user:end --> are the markers for displaying all inner data and text on POI screen (description text, photo, photo data etc). So when MultipartMainDto#getPreviewSize() != null} to display it on the screen these comments have to embrace all the description. Otherwise only description text will be visible.
      Returns:
      A <div></div> Element with a new table with tbody embraced with "desc_user" comments or just a new table with tbody for a data if MultipartMainDto#getPreviewSize() not set.

    • getUserDescriptionText

      private java.lang.String getUserDescriptionText​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment)
      In Locus a simple text with User's descriptions is placed between <!-- desc_user:start --> and <!-- desc_user:end --> xml comments (if any). In older versions it may contain HTML elements, so this method is intended to derive only text among all elements between these comments.
      Returns:
      Derived text between xml tags or empty String if nothing found.

    • getTableRowsWithMinDateTime

      private org.jsoup.select.Elements getTableRowsWithMinDateTime​(org.jsoup.select.Elements htmlElements)
      Filters td Elements with DateTime, gets the earliest, gets its Parent Node with all the table rows which contain the whole description of a POI.
      Returns:
      new Elements("<tr>") with the whole POI description for the earliest DateTime or empty Elements collection (.size() == 0)

    • getTableRowWithSeparator

      private org.jsoup.nodes.Element getTableRowWithSeparator()
      Returns:
      Just a tr with td with a hr )))

    • clearEmptyTables

      private void clearEmptyTables​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element table)
      If every within their is empty those "tr" elements will be deleted from the DOM

    • deleteImagesDuplicates

      private void deleteImagesDuplicates​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment)
      Searches for tags with same filenames in their "src" attributes and deletes them from DOM. If they're have parent nodes as - they will be deleted too.

    • addStartEndComments

      private void addStartEndComments​(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parsedHtmlFragment)
      Safe comments that make sense for only Locus Pro. Other programs will ignore it.
